title: BBC Local Live: Merseyside and west Cheshire on Monday 7 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: council under fire over 'disappointing ' river of light fireworks display .
man in court after loaded gun and ammunition found in dovecot .
plan to cut green bin collections in wirral considered .

documents.title: southport 0-0 fleetwood town
text: southport 0-0 fleetwood town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for merseyside and west cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday with more of the latest news , sport , weather and travel .

documents.title: weather : cold night ahead with ice and frost
text: a cold night ahead with ice and frost likely overnight .
temperatures down to lows of -4 .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: would you adopt a phone box ?
text: bt is asking people in warrington whether they want to keep the 39 phone boxes across the borough - and if they want to `` adopt '' a red heritage box .
the communications company is proposing to remove all 39 phone boxes due to lack of use and the rise in mobile phone coverage .
as part of the plans , it is giving people the option to adopt a traditional red phone box to make them `` a community asset '' .

documents.title: building bonanza beckons as sefton 's local plan nears completion
text: plans which will see more than 11,000 new homes built across sefton are a step nearer completion .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: pm raises case of 'chennai six ' in india
text: prime minister theresa may has raised the case of six british ex-servicemen jailed in india with her opposite number , narendra modi .

ray tindall , from chester , is one of the so-called chennai six who were each sentenced to five years in prison after a court found they had entered indian waters in 2013 without permission and carrying unlicensed firearms .
mrs may told mr modi during talks in new delhi that the men 's plight was `` a case of concern '' in the uk .

british sources said that mr modi assured the pm he was aware of uk 's concerns and held out the prospect of considering whether there was anything that could be done by the two governments once the current appeal process has concluded .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: fireworks company says river of light was 'outstanding '
text: the company who put on the fireworks display for saturday 's river of light event on the river mersey has defended it - saying it was outstanding .

many spectators took to social media to criticise the evening - a joint event with liverpool and wirral councils in partnership with sponsors - saying the lack of music and atmosphere was a let down .
star fireworks say they were n't aware that some people could n't hear the accompanying music until after the event and this might have affected the experience .
we think that the display was absolutely outstanding the feedback that we 've had to us has been very positive .
people saying that the soundtrack was amazing and the show looked really good . ''

documents.title: fewer fireworks incidents over bonfire period
text: there has been a decrease in the number of incidents involving fireworks during the bonfire period this year .
there were only seven incidents involving fireworks , compared with 20 during the period from 19 october to 6 november 2015 .
firefighters attended 541 deliberate fires - a slight increase .
from 411 last year but significantly fewer than the figure of 1,704 in 2006 .

documents.title: football : everton 's moshiri to back koeman in transfer market
text: everton 's majority shareholder farhad moshiri has said he intends to back his `` committed and ruthless '' manager ronald koeman in the transfer market .
moshiri also insisted that he is moving ahead with the project to finalise plans for a new stadium .
he has revealed that everton are now in a much better financial position after he paid off the club 's debts .

documents.title: body of a woman found by dog walkers on ainsdale beach
text: the body of a woman who is believed to be in her late twenties has been found on ainsdale beach today .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: murder accused refuses to leave cell for court hearing
text: a man charged with murder following the disappearance of a woman from cheshire has refused to leave his cell for a court hearing that then went ahead in his absence .
craig andrew proctor , 39 , of shephard close in ellesmere port , was due to appear at chester crown court accused of murdering ellia arathoon , who went missing on 28 october .
no indication of plea was given at the hearing .
mr proctor will remain in custody until the case is next heard on 2 december .

documents.title: extra money approved for hoylake golf resort
text: wirral councillors have approved a request to increase the amount of money the authority is spending on preparation work for a new £ 190m golf resort for hoylake in wirral .
initially £ 237,000 was initially set aside but the budget has now been raised to almost £ 600,000 which will be used on a study of a former landfill site and legal and consultant fees .

text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: residents face charge for having their green bin emptied
text: warrington residents are facing a £ 30 annual bill to have their green waste collected under new cuts revealed by the council .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: football : why liverpool are better than in 2013-14
text: liverpool 's goal rush , kane 's taste for derbies and another landmark for ibrahimovic - the stats and facts from the weekend 's premier league action crunched .
author: BBC Sport

text: a dry and fine afternoon but feeling cold with a risk of the odd shower .
highs of 8c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: finishing touches to st john 's market ahead of reopening
text: traders at st john 's market in liverpool are putting the finishing touches to their stalls ahead of reopening next week .
the market - one of the oldest in the country - has been closed since june for a £ 2.5m revamp .

documents.title: last post performed as wwi servicemen added to liverpool roll of honour
text: a bugler performed the last post during a ceremony to add the names of 22 servicemen to the world war one roll of honour at liverpool town hall .
22 names are added to the roll of honour @ twitterid which records soldiers who fell in # ww1 # rememberanceday

documents.title: burscough stadium plans to be approved despite objections
text: plans to build a new football stadium are set to go ahead despite objection from parties including the parish council .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: what did you think of the river of light fireworks ?
text: culture liverpool are asking people who attended the river of light fireworks display how they think it can be improved for next year .
more than a 250,000 spectators are thought to have lined the banks of the mersey for the fireworks display - but many complained about a lack of music and atmosphere around the event .
we want your feedback folks on # riveroflight - the good , bad & the ugly !
we want to hear from you to shape 2017 !
not enough catering and entertainment also fireworks a bit far away on wirral side
but a step in the right direction thanks
completed survey .
personally we really enjoyed the display from seacombe , just needed music being played there .

documents.title: liverpool businesses 'would n't hesitate ' to fund future bonfire events
text: the chief executive of liverpool 's business improvement district has said he `` would n't hesitate '' to fund future bonfire night events on the waterfront after many were left disappointed .
more than 250,000 spectators are thought to have turned out for saturday 's river of light fireworks display - but many complained about the lack of music and atmosphere .
wirral and liverpool council cancelled eight park displays to put on the event , which was also paid for by businesses in the city centre .
chief executive bill addy said they `` have n't been put off by the backlash '' .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: twenty-two servicemen names to be added to liverpool roll of honour
text: the names of a further 22 servicemen who died in wwi are to be added to the roll of honour at liverpool town hall today .
they will feature alongside 13,000 names already on the memorial .
the roll was initially unveiled by the prince of wales in 1921 and new names are added as they are identified .

documents.title: wirral golf resort plans expected to be approved
text: wirral council is expected to give the go ahead later to spending almost £ 600,000 on preparing plans to build a controversial golf resort in hoylake .
the scheme , involving a new course , hotel and housing , would see an existing municipal gold course moved and development on green belt land .
the money will be used to pay consultants .
the council has already spent almost £ 250,000 pounds on the project .

documents.title: youth 'in fear ' boasted of machete before being chased through great sankey
text: a teenager who was chased through great sankey by police after boasting that he had a machete and planned to get a grenade has been sentenced to 16 weeks in custody .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: lower benefits cap 'will affect hundreds ' of merseyside families
text: hundreds of households across merseyside are expected to be affected by a new cap on benefits which comes into effect today .
the cap reduces the total amount a household can receive in benefits from £ 26,000 to £ 20,000 .
its aim is to ensure households claiming benefits are no better off than the average family in work - but critics say it will lead to evictions and greater homelessness .

documents.title: wirral care home up for three awards after being named 'outstanding ' by the cqc
text: a wirral care home is up for a trio of awards after being named `` outstanding '' by the care quality commission .
author: Wirral Globe

documents.title: southport man 'sacked after cancer diagnosis '
text: a man has said he was sacked from his job after being diagnosed with cancer .
terry foster , 58 , from southport , said he was `` treated appallingly '' by his employer .
he was diagnosed with lymphoma in 2010 and spent 19 days in intensive care - at one stage being given hours to live .
he took doctors by surprise , began to recover and , with a newborn child , hoped he could return to work as a refrigeration engineer .
he drove two-and-a-half-hours to meet his manager , but on arrival was told he `` was going to be sacked '' , he said .
mr foster took the company to an employment tribunal , representing himself , and was awarded more than £ 62,000 for unfair dismissal .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: row over plans to reduce bin collections in wirral
text: a row is brewing in wirral over plans reduce the number of bin collections at domestic properties .
the council is proposing to empty general waste bins only once every three weeks - and introduce a new container for food waste .
opposition councillors say the plans have n't been thought through properly , and could lead to an increase in fly tipping .

documents.title: football : klopp plays down liverpool title talk
text: liverpool manager jurgen klopp played down talk of a title challenge despite his side topping the premier league for the first time since may 2014 .
two and a half years after the reds finished two points behind champions manchester city , a 6-1 win over watford moved them one point clear of chelsea .
city and arsenal - third and fourth respectively - are one further back .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: men due in court over gun and drugs finds
text: two men are due to appear in court after weapons and drugs were found during searches .
police found a loaded gun and ammunition during a search of a house in dovecot .
a 21-year-old mas has been charged with firearms offences .
in a separate incident , two guns and drugs were recovered from a property on saturday .
a 48-year-old man , croxteth man , has also been charged .
they are due to appear at liverpool magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: head of culture at liverpool council defends river of light fireworks display
text: the head of culture at liverpool city council is defending saturday 's river of light festival - after hundreds of people criticised the event on social media .
more than a 250,000 spectators are thought to have lined the banks of the mersey for the fireworks display - but many complained about a lack of music and atmosphere around the event .
the show was paid for by local businesses .
culture director claire mccolgan says they will `` listen to all of the feedback '' , but believes `` it 's right to be ambitious '' .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: travel : accident and fuel spillage on m53
text: there is queuing traffic and one lane is closed on the m53 southbound at junction 7 because of an accident and a fuel spillage .
congestion is to junction 3 at woodchurch and on the a41 new chester road .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello from liverpool , i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates from across merseyside and west cheshire today .
if you 've got a story you 'd like me to hear about or a photograph you 'd like to share , you can contact me on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live
